content.raw:
You are right, probably something like cherry pick would have helped in this case, I miss git a lot when things like playing with branches need to be done.

I believe that I currently have write permissions on your repository, so that helps to build the proper solution there.

From what I see about your work, most of the things are done and now I need to work on integrating them with our standard process of releasing and testing the whole thing. Enjoy your holidays and thanks for all the work.

pullrequest.title: Make Gazebo package follow the Debian guidelines

content.raw:
Haha, ok :)

I am really not a mercurial expert but if there is an equivalent of git cherry-pick this would probably be the easiest solution.

Regarding man pages and wrapper, I inserted this to avoid having to wait for the next release but I am already following the other pull requests/commits to fix that in upstream. They are separate commits so please discard them if you prefer directly handle that in next release. Just be aware you will have more lintian issues than reported here.

I accepted your pull requests on my repo. If you need write access, please tell me.

BTW one reason I wanted to do that now is that I will take holidays the next two weeks so it will be more difficult to contact me.
content.html:
Haha, ok :)

I am really not a mercurial expert but if there is an equivalent of git cherry-pick this would probably be the easiest solution.

Regarding man pages and wrapper, I inserted this to avoid having to wait for the next release but I am already following the other pull requests/commits to fix that in upstream. They are separate commits so please discard them if you prefer directly handle that in next release. Just be aware you will have more lintian issues than reported here.

I accepted your pull requests on my repo. If you need write access, please tell me.

BTW one reason I wanted to do that now is that I will take holidays the next two weeks so it will be more difficult to contact me.

content.raw: My try to import your default repo branch into a branch in this repository was an epic fail and end up with all changes landed into default ... stupid mercurial. I've reverted the situation. Let's make the changes in your repo, I have leave there a couple of pull requests, and back to try to merge with this one.

pull_request.title: Make Gazebo package follow the Debian guidelines

update.description:
Here is a large set of patches which are merging my current changes into gazebo-release.

Considering I am not sure how you feed this into your buildfarm and I did not compile this into Ubuntu, please proceed with caution.

Of course, we are also now missing the sdformat package on Debian to have this working in Sid.

I am currently checking this against my Sid distribution (without sdformat) and so far so good. I will update the pull request if I fix issues.

Please consider merging the first six patches into gazebo-release as they should not break anything.

The tip of this branch builds successfully on Debian Sid 64-bits and Ubuntu Precise (10.04) 64-bits.

I: gazebo-plugin-base: hardening-no-fortify-functions usr/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/gazebo-1.9/plugins/libVehiclePlugin.so
```

# Roadmap #

 * Fix VERSION/SOVERSION in SET_TARGET_PROPERTIES to 1.9 instead of 1. I.e. it seems unrealistic to have gazebo break its ABI only on major releases. It will fix the package-name-doesnt-match-sonames warning.
 * Remove the cmake/ directories and replace them by patches in debian/patches
 * Install the versioned binaries into /usr/lib/<ARCH>/gazebo/ to remove the binary-without-manpages issues.
 * Remove gazebo-wrapper when the next version will be released.
 * [Generate symbols file.](http://www.eyrie.org/~eagle/journal/2012-01/008.html)

# Wishlist / Maybe #

 * [Autopkgtest support](http://developer.ubuntu.com/packaging/html/auto-pkg-test.html)
 * Use update-alternatives to generate non-versioned binaries symbolic link. Support fully coinstallable Gazebo installations? (to do so gazebo should be renamed into gazebo1.9)

update.description:
Here is a large set of patches which are merging my current changes into gazebo-release.

Considering I am not sure how you feed this into your buildfarm and I did not compile this into Ubuntu, please proceed with caution.

Of course, we are also now missing the sdformat package on Debian to have this working in Sid.

I am currently checking this against my Sid distribution (without sdformat) and so far so good. I will update the pull request if I fix issues.

Please consider merging the first six patches into gazebo-release as they should not break anything.

The tip of this branch builds successfully on Debian Sid 64-bits and Ubuntu Precise (10.04) 64-bits.

```

# Roadmap #

 * Fix VERSION/SOVERSION in SET_TARGET_PROPERTIES to 1.9 instead of 1. I.e. it seems unrealistic to have gazebo break its ABI only on major releases. It will fix the package-name-doesnt-match-sonames warning.
 * Remove the cmake/ directories and replace them by patches in debian/patches
 * Install the versioned binaries into /usr/lib/<ARCH>/gazebo/ to remove the binary-without-manpages issues.
 * Remove gazebo-wrapper when the next version will be released.
 * [Generate symbols file.](http://www.eyrie.org/~eagle/journal/2012-01/008.html)

# Wishlist / Maybe #

 * [Autopkgtest support](http://developer.ubuntu.com/packaging/html/auto-pkg-test.html)
 * Use update-alternatives to generate non-versioned binaries symbolic link. Support fully coinstallable Gazebo installations? (to do so gazebo should be renamed into gazebo1.9)

update.description:
Here is a large set of patches which are merging my current changes into gazebo-release.

Considering I am not sure how you feed this into your buildfarm and I did not compile this into Ubuntu, please proceed with caution.

Of course, we are also now missing the sdformat package on Debian to have this working in Sid.

I am currently checking this against my Sid distribution (without sdformat) and so far so good. I will update the pull request if I fix issues.

Please consider merging the first six patches into gazebo-release as they should not break anything.

The tip of this branch builds successfully on Debian Sid 64-bits and Ubuntu Precise (10.04) 64-bits.

```

# Roadmap #

 * Fix VERSION/SOVERSION in SET_TARGET_PROPERTIES to 1.9 instead of 1. I.e. it seems unrealistic to have gazebo break its ABI only on major releases. It will fix the package-name-doesnt-match-sonames warning.
 * Remove the cmake/ directories and replace them by patches in debian/patches
 * Install the versioned binaries into /usr/lib/<ARCH>/gazebo/ to remove the binary-without-manpages issues.
 * Remove gazebo-wrapper when the next version will be released.
 * [Generate symbols file.](http://www.eyrie.org/~eagle/journal/2012-01/008.html)

# Wishlist / Maybe #

 * [Autopkgtest support](http://developer.ubuntu.com/packaging/html/auto-pkg-test.html)
 * Use update-alternatives to generate non-versioned binaries symbolic link. Support fully coinstallable Gazebo installations? (to do so gazebo should be renamed into gazebo1.9)

update.description:
Here is a large set of patches which are merging my current changes into gazebo-release.

Considering I am not sure how you feed this into your buildfarm and I did not compile this into Ubuntu, please proceed with caution.

Of course, we are also now missing the sdformat package on Debian to have this working in Sid.

I am currently checking this against my Sid distribution (without sdformat) and so far so good. I will update the pull request if I fix issues.

Please consider merging the first six patches into gazebo-release as they should not break anything.

The tip of this branch builds successfully on Debian Sid 64-bits and Ubuntu Precise (10.04) 64-bits.

```

# Roadmap #

 * Fix VERSION/SOVERSION in SET_TARGET_PROPERTIES to 1.9 instead of 1. I.e. it seems unrealistic to have gazebo break its ABI only on major releases. It will fix the package-name-doesnt-match-sonames warning.
 * Remove the cmake/ directories and replace them by patches in debian/patches
 * Install the versioned binaries into /usr/lib/<ARCH>/gazebo/ to remove the binary-without-manpages issues.
 * Remove gazebo-wrapper when the next version will be released.
 * [Generate symbols file.](http://www.eyrie.org/~eagle/journal/2012-01/008.html)

# Wishlist / Maybe #

 * [Autopkgtest support](http://developer.ubuntu.com/packaging/html/auto-pkg-test.html)
 * Use update-alternatives to generate non-versioned binaries symbolic link. Support fully coinstallable Gazebo installations? (to do so gazebo should be renamed into gazebo1.9)

pullrequest.title: Make Gazebo package follow the Debian guidelines

content.raw:
Impressive work, thanks a lot @thomas_moulard 

Lot of changes in this pull request, I'm afraid that we can not handle all of them at the same time. I can see three main categories of changes in this patch: 

**1. Changes already fixed or close to be fixed in gazebo upstream**

 * The setup.sh problem should not require the wrapper, as discussed in issue #36 
 * Gazebo full manpages are close to be ready, see discussion and code in [gazebo pull request 623](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-request/623/manpages-for-gazebo-binaries)

**2. Changes that will need a fix in our build farm **

 * Gazebo package split into proper smaller packages
 
**3. Changes ready to be merged**

 * All the rest, including symbol, changes about shlibs, etc.

I will rework from your branch to made the changes needed, specially those in point 1, and create a branch in this own gazebo-release repo.
content.html:
Impressive work, thanks a lot @thomas_moulard

Lot of changes in this pull request, I'm afraid that we can not handle all of them at the same time. I can see three main categories of changes in this patch:

1. Changes already fixed or close to be fixed in gazebo upstream

  • The setup.sh problem should not require the wrapper, as discussed in issue #36
  • Gazebo full manpages are close to be ready, see discussion and code in gazebo pull request 623

2. Changes that will need a fix in our build farm

  • Gazebo package split into proper smaller packages

3. Changes ready to be merged

  • All the rest, including symbol, changes about shlibs, etc.

I will rework from your branch to made the changes needed, specially those in point 1, and create a branch in this own gazebo-release repo.

update.description:
Here is a large set of patches which are merging my current changes into gazebo-release.

Considering I am not sure how you feed this into your buildfarm and I did not compile this into Ubuntu, please proceed with caution.

Of course, we are also now missing the sdformat package on Debian to have this working in Sid.

I am currently checking this against my Sid distribution (without sdformat) and so far so good. I will update the pull request if I fix issues.

Please consider merging the first six patches into gazebo-release as they should not break anything.

The tip of this branch builds successfully on Debian Sid 64-bits and Ubuntu Precise (10.04) 64-bits.

# Roadmap #

 * Fix VERSION/SOVERSION in SET_TARGET_PROPERTIES to 1.9 instead of 1. I.e. it seems unrealistic to have gazebo break its ABI only on major releases. It will fix the package-name-doesnt-match-sonames warning.
 * Remove the cmake/ directories and replace them by patches in debian/patches
 * Install the versioned binaries into /usr/lib/<ARCH>/gazebo/ to remove the binary-without-manpages issues.
 * Remove gazebo-wrapper when the next version will be released.
 * [Generate symbols file.](http://www.eyrie.org/~eagle/journal/2012-01/008.html)

# Wishlist / Maybe #

 * [Autopkgtest support](http://developer.ubuntu.com/packaging/html/auto-pkg-test.html)
 * Use update-alternatives to generate non-versioned binaries symbolic link. Support fully coinstallable Gazebo installations? (to do so gazebo should be renamed into gazebo1.9)

pull_request.title: Make Gazebo package follow the Debian guidelines

update.description:
Here is a large set of patches which are merging my current changes into gazebo-release.

Considering I am not sure how you feed this into your buildfarm and I did not compile this into Ubuntu, please proceed with caution.

Of course, we are also now missing the sdformat package on Debian to have this working in Sid.

I am currently checking this against my Sid distribution (without sdformat) and so far so good. I will update the pull request if I fix issues.

Please consider merging the first six patches into gazebo-release as they should not break anything.

The tip of this branch builds successfully on Debian Sid 64-bits and Ubuntu Precise (10.04) 64-bits.

update.title: Make Gazebo package follow the Debian guidelines

pull_request.title: Make Gazebo package follow the Debian guidelines

update.description:
Here is a large set of patches which are merging my current changes into gazebo-release.

Considering I am not sure how you feed this into your buildfarm and I did not compile this into Ubuntu, please proceed with caution.

Of course, we are also now missing the sdformat package on Debian to have this working in Sid.

I am currently checking this against my Sid distribution (without sdformat) and so far so good. I will update the pull request if I fix issues.

Please consider merging the first six patches into gazebo-release as they should not break anything.

The tip of this branch builds successfully on Debian Sid.
